even.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying
even.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
She did not even bother to phone us.
He never even acknowledged my letter.
even.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to add a stronger, more exact word to what you are saying
even.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Some patients become depressed, even suicidal.
even.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0]: You use even before a person, thing, or phrase, when you want to emphasize what you are saying
Even young children know the difference between right and wrong
Poverty exists even in rich countries
even.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1]: You use even before a verb
He even offered to buy me a drink
even.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2]: You use even after an auxiliary verb
He has even offered to buy me a drink
even.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3]: You use even though and even if when saying that something happens or is true in spite of another thing
Even though she was tired, she carried on walking
We’re still going to the concert, even if it rains
even.translation[0].note_box[0].items[4]: You can use even though and even if with still
Even though we’re completely different, we’re still friends
Even though we’re completely different, yet we’re friends
Even though we’re completely different, but we’re friends
even.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: flat and level, with no parts that are higher than other parts
even.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The floor must be completely even before we lay the tiles.
You need a flat, even surface to work on.
He had lovely white, even teeth.
even.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: an even rate, speed, or temperature is steady and does not change
even.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The room is kept at an even temperature.
Wood burns at a fairly even rate.
even.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: divided equally, so that there is the same amount of something in each place, for each person etc
even.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Divide the dough into three even amounts.
even.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: an even number can be divided exactly by two
even.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: having teams or competitors that are equally good so that everyone has a chance of winning
even.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: The first half was very even, and neither side scored.
even.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: if the score in a game is even, two teams or players have the same number of points
even.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: At the end of the first half the score is even.
even.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: calm and controlled, and not extreme
even.translation[1].definitions[6].examp: He read most of the speech in an even tone.
even.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: staying at the same level, rather than frequently changing from one level to the other
even.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Strong trade will encourage more even selling.
even.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: giving two sides, things, ideas etc equal or fair treatment
even.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: We should try to create a more even balance between work and recreation.
even.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: in whole numbers, to the nearest ten, hundred etc
even.translation[3].definitions[3].defin: an even account is the same on each side, so that there is neither a credit nor a debit balance
